description: T1 -Gleditsia  Adjacent to property - Remove lowest limb growing south over property to main stem, crown lift by 2m to balance. Thin crown density by 30% via removal of crossing branches and secondary growth. T2-False acacia Adjacent to property - Thin crown density by 30% via removal of crossing branches and secondary growth. Remove deadwood T3-False acacia Adjacent to property - Thin crown density by 30% via removal of crossing branches and secondary growth. Remove deadwood. Remove lowest branch growing towards property. T4-False acacia Adjacent to property - Thin crown density by 30% via removal of crossing branches and secondary growth. Remove deadwood. Remove lowest branch spur growing towards property. T5 -False acacia Central lawn overhanging phone lines - Clean out crown via removal of sucker growth, remove deadwood, hanging branch and snapped limb. T6-False acacia Central lawn - Clean out crown via removal of sucker growth, remove deadwood. T7-False acacia Central lawn - Clean out crown via removal of sucker growth, remove deadwood. Check cobra brace and install new brace if required. T8- Lawson Cypress -Adjacent to driveway gates - Low amenity value tree previously reduced. Fell to ground level via sectional takedown. T9- Sycamore -Adjacent to driveway gates  - Twin stem tree previously reduced approx. 3 years ago. Prune off basal growth around stems and remove stem sucker growth. T10- Sycamore -Overhanging road, adjacent to Yew trees.	Self seeded tree. Fell to ground level and poison stump to inhibit regrowth. T11-Sycamore North boundary 	Semi mature tree previously reduced, significant dieback throughout canopy. Remove deadwood weak or suppressed branches. T13-Holly 	Outside west entrance to property. Mature tree leaning towards property causing significant shading. Reduce main stem leaning towards house by 3-4m in height to growth point Tree is currently 8m in height, after reduction be approx 6m in height and leaving spread 3m
